Response: It was very helpful to see the animations of what was happening. I think the class was good, it'll just take time for many of the concepts to soak in and to get familiar with using them. Sometimes the examples seem very simplified versions of the kind of data we will work with (which of course I recognize is also important!), but every now and then it would help to see how you would do this with an actual dataset.

Maybe not relevant anymore, but more time for practice problems and less time answering people's specific questions about the workings of particular functions. That seems like something better answered by practice and less by whether or not you happen to know the specific peculiarities of the function. Sorry I contributed to this problem.
Thanks for the class. Your rmarkdowns are amazing and I am sure they will serve as good resources even after this class is over. Love the animations, they really help to visualize abstract concepts.
a lot of the functions you mentioned today seem really helpful, thanks!
more time for practice problems. those are the best! Thanks for all the time you put in. you're the best!
Love that we're starting with practical exercises in R! Excited to learn more stats so that I know how/when to apply these skills. Thanks!
